titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of a Borrower's Card: Agnes Claudius

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Encoded cards and addressed the following issues: s1: = lots of cross-outs on "Symposium" line ==> "0.50 a day 1.00" s2: = "Cromen"? ==> "Cromer" = "thai"? ==> "THIN s3: = "ing"? and "Rome"? ==> "Coming Struggle for Power" = "Jlat"? ==> HAT (Roman Hat) = "Tone and Rivin"? ==> Of Time and River (Time and THE River) s4: = no idea, "Draghiheff"? ==> "Diaghileff" = bunch of stuff crossed out, barely legible ==> Payment information confirmed = "Shun"? editor of "Soviet Literature" = "Cour"? ==> CORN = no idea ==> Secret War (...still unclear) s5: = no idea s6: = no idea ==> "Luhan" = no idea ==> "Washington Legation Murders" s7: = "Narration"? and "15" has something illegible before it, doesn't look like a month = no idea = crossed out payment = difficult to read payment info = no idea s8: No year date on card, and the dates are not continuous with the recto side: I set the date at 1936, based on the issue dates of the NYer It picks up where s6 leaves off... s9: = no idea ==> Well of Loneliness s10: Verso has upside-down beginning of SACRESTE card s13: = "People"? written over and difficult to read = cross-out on name, hard to read s15: Half of a mailing label? = writing under "Claudius" is illegible ==> Queen End, Purleigh, Essex s16: Another form, with writing "19-9 B" scrawled upside down

transcribed cards s1: = lots of cross-outs on "Symposium" line s2: = "Cromen"? = "thai"? s3: = "ing"? and "Rome"? = "Jlat"? = "Tone and Rivin"? s4: = no idea, "Draghiheff"? = bunch of stuff crossed out, barely legible = "Shun"? editor of "Soviet Literature" = "Cour"? = no idea s5: = no idea s6: = no idea = no idea s7: = "Narration"? and "15" has something illegible before it, doesn't look like a month = no idea = crossed out payment = difficult to read payment info = no idea s9: = no idea s10: Verso has upside-down beginning of SACRESTE card s13: = "People"? written over and difficult to read = cross-out on name, hard to read s15: Half of a mailing label? = writing under "Claudius" is illegible s16: Another form, with writing "19-9 B" scrawled upside down

div.head:
1933 Oct 28 CLAUDIUS Miss Agnes Claudius
l'Auberge du Navigateur Dan 62-78
Zervudachi Garden Villa Bacos Ramleh AlexandriaEgypt
until 10am
div.note: 1 m 1 v 12 dep ref. 30 sept 14 1934 (left dep. June 28)

Oct 24 pd 10v pd 22.50
bal due 10 pd
Dec 3. Waugh in Abyssinia not taken
div.ab: May 15. They wed in country down. May 18.
21. Ralph Fox Writer in Arms _ 50c a day May 25

div.note: owes 10frs for the story mag: pd
Dec 23 Madame Champagne paid 28 frs to SB for Metamorphosis SB delivered " at the Briffaults on xmas Day (2nd attempt was successful) 1940 couldn't find last card Punch & Judy returned Sept 14 1940
1 m 1 v B 45 f Dep. on a/c March 8 10 balance March 9 35 for postage on/ a/c/ 15 for postage

ab.note: come back by chemin de fer

note.bibl: Herbert Reed. Art now. Now Gentlemen, please Towlinson The day before Martin Hare Polonaise S. Spender Still Centre Saurat Three Conventions Leonard Q. Ross Strangest Places M. Rawlings The Yearling Jonah's Gourd Vine May Sarton Single Hound Partisan review. Hemingway. Fifth Column Hidden Lincoln Helen Waddel Peter Abelard Villard Some Newspapers Newspaper men - M Lagden The Beginning Kafka America Wilson The triple thinker Le Galliene At 33 Mann Escape to Life

div.note: F.M. Ford It was the nightingale. Kay Boyle Gentlemen I address you privately Plagued by the nightingale Breuer Bessie either of hers _
